author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
The Delhi High Court on Wednesday reserved its order on a writ petition seeking stay on the release of a Hindi film, Santa Banta Pvt. Ltd. , on the ground of its allegedly objectionable references to the Sikh community. The Court said it would pronounce its verdict after watching the movie.

A Division Bench, comprising Chief Justice G. Rohini and Justice Jayant Nath, directed the producers to submit CDs of the movie, its trailer and preamble for its perusal.

The plea was moved by the Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee, which has contended that the film, to be released on April 22, makes fun of the Sikh community and could lead to disturbances.

Santa Banta Pvt. Ltd. makes objectionable references to Sikhs, the plea alleges
title: HC reserves order on plea against Santa Banta release
